byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY and CHARLOTTE YANG

abstract: Hong Kong activists Joshua Wong and Nathan Law are sentenced to community service and another,  Alex Chow, receives three-week jail term for involvement in demonstration that led to large pro-democracy street protests in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The activists Joshua Wong and Nathan Law were spared jail in a 2014 protest that led to pro-democracy sit-ins, and a third defendant’s jail term was suspended.
snippet: The activists Joshua Wong and Nathan Law were spared jail in a 2014 protest that led to pro-democracy sit-ins, and a third defendant’s jail term was suspended....

headline.main: Hong Kong Protest Leaders Sentenced to Community Service
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Spares 3 Protesters From Jail
